intro: Licania caldasiana, commonly known as the Caldasian licania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
